snippet: Mieczyslaw Weinberg’s opera “The Passenger,” at the Park Avenue Armory, explores a fateful encounter between a former Nazi death camp inmate and her SS overseer.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews production of Mieczyslaw Weinberg opera The Passenger, directed by David Pountney and starring mezzo-soprano Michelle Breedt, at Park Avenue Armory as part of Lincoln Center Festival.
lead_paragraph: Mieczyslaw Weinberg’s opera “The Passenger,” at the Park Avenue Armory, explores a fateful encounter between a former Nazi death camp inmate and her SS overseer.
